servinfo.title: Cylinder Head Cover Removal and Installation

s1.ptxt: Disconnect negative cable at battery.
Remove engine cover.
Disconnect ignition coil couplers (1).
Remove ignition coils (4).
Remove oil level gauge (6).
Disconnect CMP sensor coupler (5) from cylinder head cover.
Disconnect breather hose (2) and PCV hose (3) from cylinder head cover (7).
Remove PCV valve from cylinder head cover.
Remove cylinder head cover nuts in such order as indicated in the figure.
Install PCV valve to cylinder head cover referring to PCV Valve Removal and Installation:For Petrol Engine Model .
Remove oil, old sealant and dust from sealing surfaces on cylinder head and cover.
Install new cylinder head side seals (1) to cylinder head.
Apply sealant “A” to cylinder head sealing surface area as shown in figure.
Install new O-rings (3) and new cylinder head cover gasket (2) to cylinder head cover (1).

attention3.ptxt: Be sure to check each of these parts for deterioration or any damage before installation and replace if found defective.

s1.ptxt: Install cylinder head cover to cylinder head.
Tighten cylinder head cover nuts in such order as indicated in the figure a little at a time till they are tightened to specified torque.
Install oil level gauge (1).
Connect CMP sensor coupler (4).
Connect breather hose (2) and PCV hose (3) to cylinder head cover.
Install ignition coils referring to Ignition Coil Assembly (Including ignitor) Removal and Installation:For Petrol Engine Model .
Install engine cover.
Connect negative cable at battery.
